parties.raw_snippet:
the undersigned, the Integrity Short Term
Government Fund, (the “Fund”), an open-end, diversified, management investment company organized as a series of The Integrity
Funds, a Delaware statutory trust, has agreed that Integrity Funds Distributor, LLC, (“Integrity”), shall be, for the period of this
distribution agreement (the “Agreement”), the principal underwriter of shares issued by the Fund, including such classes of shares
as may now or hereafter be authorized (the “Shares”).
parties.reasoning: The opening paragraph identifies the contracting entities: the Integrity Short Term Government Fund (referred to as the “Fund”) and Integrity Funds Distributor, LLC (referred to as “Integrity”). These are the parties entering the agreement and performing the obligations (Fund issuing shares; Integrity acting as underwriter/distributor).

contract_type.reasoning: The agreement's title and the substantive obligations (Section 1.1: Integrity will act as principal underwriter for the distribution of the Shares; Sections describing solicitation, distribution expenses, and distribution/service fees) show the primary purpose is to appoint a distributor/underwriter to distribute fund shares.

agreement_date.reasoning: The date appears at the top of the contract under the title and is also repeated in the signature block as the date of the agreement; this is the date the agreement was signed/made.

effective_date.raw_snippet: In Witness Whereof, the parties hereto have caused this Agreement to be executed as of the date first set forth herein.
effective_date.reasoning: The execution clause states the agreement is executed "as of the date first set forth herein," which is the header date "January 18, 2020." Therefore the effective date is the agreement/signature date.

expiration_date.raw_snippet:
Section 7.1 This Agreement shall continue until January 18, 2022, and thereafter shall continue automatically for successive annual
periods ending on January 18th of each year, provided such continuance is specifically approved at least annually by (a) the Fund’s
Board of Trustees and (b) a vote of a majority (as defined in the 1940 Act) of the Fund’s Trustees who are not interested persons
(as defined in the 1940 Act) of the Fund and who have no direct or indirect financial interest in the operation of the Plan, in this
Agreement, or any agreement related to the Plan (the “Qualified Trustees”), by vote cast in person at a meeting called for the
purpose of voting on such approval.
expiration_date.reasoning: Section 7.1 explicitly sets the initial term to a calendar date (until January 18, 2022) and then describes the post-term renewal mechanism. The explicit calendar date is the stated expiration of the initial term.

governing_law.raw_snippet: Section 8.3 This Agreement shall be construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Kansas.
governing_law.reasoning: Section 8.3 contains the governing law clause specifying which jurisdiction's laws govern the agreement.

notice_period.raw_snippet: This Agreement is terminable with respect to the Fund, without penalty, (a) on 60 days’ written notice, by vote of a majority of the Qualified Trustees or by vote of a majority (as defined in the 1940 Act) of the outstanding voting securities of the Fund or (b) on 90 days’ written notice by Integrity.
notice_period.reasoning: Section 7.1 provides the notice periods for termination which would prevent continuation/renewal: 60 days' written notice (by the Fund via specified votes) and 90 days' written notice (by Integrity). There is no separate clause stating a different advance-notice-before-renewal requirement.

renewal_term.raw_snippet: and thereafter shall continue automatically for successive annual periods ending on January 18th of each year, provided such continuance is specifically approved at least annually by (a) the Fund’s Board of Trustees and (b) a vote of a majority (as defined in the 1940 Act) of the Fund’s Trustees ... (the “Qualified Trustees”), by vote cast in person at a meeting called for the purpose of voting on such approval.
renewal_term.reasoning: Section 7.1 states the contract will continue automatically after the initial term in successive annual periods (each ending January 18th), i.e., one-year automatic renewals, subject to specified annual approvals.
